Q1: Who is Peter Levin?
A1: Peter Levin is an American director of film, television, and theatre.

Q2: What are some of the television series credits of Peter Levin?
A2: Some of Peter Levin's television series credits include "Love Is a Many Splendored Thing," "James at 15," "The Paper Chase," "Family," "Starsky & Hutch," "Lou Grant," "Fame," "Cagney & Lacey," and "Law & Order."

Q3: What are some of the television films credits of Peter Levin?
A3: Some of Peter Levin's television film credits include "Rape and Marriage: The Rideout Case" (1980), "A Reason to Live" (1985), "Popeye Doyle" (1986), "A Killer Among Us" (1990), "Queen Sized" (2008), and others.

Q4: What did Peter Levin do before becoming a director?
A4: Before becoming a director, Peter Levin worked as an actor in several Broadway productions. He also trained at the Carnegie Mellon University.

Q5: Can you tell me more about Peter Levin's theatre career?
A5: Yes, Peter Levin co-founded the off-off-Broadway Theatre [the Hardware Poets Playhouse] with his wife Audrey Davis Levin and was also an associate artist of The Interact Theatre Company.

Q6: What is the name of the Emmy-winning special directed by Peter Levin's wife?
A6: The Emmy-winning special directed by Peter Levin's wife is titled "[The Diary of Ann Frank]."

Q7: How did Peter Levin get drafted into the Army?
A7: According to the passage, Peter Levin got drafted into the Army when he was starring in the Broadway production of "[The Diary of Ann Frank]."

Q8: What is the name of the university where Peter Levin trained?
A8: The university where Peter Levin trained is Carnegie Mellon University.

Q9: Can you tell me more about Peter Levin's wife Audrey Davis Levin?
A9: Yes, Audrey Davis Levin is a writer and an actress who has worked in theatre, film, and television. She received an Emmy for Best Day Time Special in the 1970s for a special she wrote and directed.

Q10: How many credits does Peter Levin have in film and television?
A10: According to the passage, Peter Levin has amassed a large number of credits directing episodic television and television films. The exact number is not specified in the passage.

Q1: Who is Kasthuri Raja?
A1: Kasthuri Raja is an Indian film director.

Q2: What is the occupation of Kasthuri Raja?
A2: Kasthuri Raja directed films, worked as an assistant director, and also acted in a few movies.

Q3: What is the background of Kasthuri Raja?
A3: Kasthuri Raja ran away from home to Chennai and worked in a mill before entering the film industry.

Q4: How many films has Kasthuri Raja directed?
A4: Kasthuri Raja directed more than 16 films, including Aval Sumangalithan (1985), Mouna Mozhi (1992), and Dreams (all songs).

Q5: What is the name of the film in which Kasthuri Raja acted as an actor?
A5: The film in which Kasthuri Raja acted as an actor is Aval Sumangalithan (1985).

Q6: How many songs did Kasthuri Raja write as a lyricist?
A6: Kasthuri Raja wrote 4 songs as a lyricist, including Solaiyamma, Dreams, Thaai Manasu, and Kummi Paatu.

A7: The film in which Kasthuri Raja worked with Director Visu is more than 16 films.

Q1: What is Brian Kennedy's current occupation?
A1: Brian Kennedy is a gallery director.

Q2: Where did Brian Kennedy work before coming to the United States?
A2: Brian Kennedy worked in Ireland, Australia, and Ohio.

Q3: What was the reason for Brian Kennedy's resignation from the Peabody Essex Museum?
A3: Brian Kennedy resigned from the Peabody Essex Museum in December 2010 due to health reasons.

Q4: What is the name of the museum where Brian Kennedy currently works?
A4: Brian Kennedy currently works at the Toledo Museum of Art.

Q5: How long did Brian Kennedy work at the National Gallery of Australia?
A5: Brian Kennedy worked at the National Gallery of Australia from 1997 to 2004, for about seven years.

Q6: What was the controversial exhibition that Brian Kennedy canceled during his tenure at the National Gallery of Australia?
A6: The controversial exhibition that Brian Kennedy canceled was "Sensation: A Feeling of Time" in 2000, which featured works by the Young British Artists.

Q7: What is Brian Kennedy's area of expertise according to his TEDx talk?
A7: According to Brian Kennedy's TEDx talk, his area of expertise is visual and sensory literacy.

Q8: How many objects does the Hood Museum of Art have in its collection?
A8: The Hood Museum of Art has over 70,000 objects in its collection.

Q1: Who is the executive director of the Sam Spiegel Film and Television School?
A1: Dana Blankstein-Cohen.

Q2: When was Dana Blankstein appointed as the executive director of the Sam Spiegel Film and Television School?
A2: In November 2019.

Q3: What is Dana Blankstein's profession?
A3: She is a film director and an Israeli culture entrepreneur.

Q4: Where was Dana Blankstein born?
A4: Switzerland.

Q5: When did Dana Blankstein move to Israel?
A5: In 1983.

Q6: What is Dana Blankstein's educational background?
A6: She graduated from the Sam Spiegel Film and Television School in 2008 with high honors.

Q7: What are some of Dana Blankstein's notable works?
A7: She directed and shot "the making of" film on Gavison's film Lost and Found, and her debut film Camping competed at the Berlin International Film Festival in 2007.

Q8: What is Dana Blankstein's current role?
A8: She is the executive director of the Sam Spiegel Film and Television School, where she also oversees the Sam Spiegel International Film Lab.

Q9: What new initiatives has Dana Blankstein spearheaded?
A9: In 2022, she launched the new Series Lab and the film preparatory program for Arabic speakers in east Jerusalem.

Q10: How many films has Dana Blankstein directed?
A10: She has directed three films: Camping (2006), Growing Pains (2008), and Tel Aviviot (2012).
